item.title: Report E-2024050727
item.description:
Report E-2024050727

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/30/2024, while loading a trailer, at Veolia's facility in Henderson, CO, a 55 gallon drum of UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquids, n.o.s, (Acetonitrile, Acetone) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 10 gallons of liquid to the trailer floor and ground beneath the trailer. No employee exposures were reported and cleanup was conducted by trained Veolia personnel. The drum was overpacked prior to being placed in transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024050729
item.description:
Report E-2024050729

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1760 J42 Tempest release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 7’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. Citric acid and absorbents were deployed to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged jugs, impacted absorbents, and PPE were then containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: As freight was being moved on the dock of the destination terminal, a forklift operator's fork made contact with this drum, causing puncture and a release of material. The drum was immediately turned onto it's side and placed into an overpack container to prevent further release. The released material was neutralized and absorbed. Due to the material being hazardous, the packaging specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

item.title: Report E-2024050726
item.description:
Report E-2024050726

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NBM experienced a UN2693 Chemtron De-Ox release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the wood trailer floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. Soda ash and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050725
item.description:
Report E-2024050725

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XML experienced a UN3267 WT680 Precipitant release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to a 0.5’ x 0.5’ area of the trailer floor and top of the drum due to a loose bung. The impacted areas were cleaned with citric acid solution and absorbent pads to clean and neutralize the material. The bung cap was resecured, and a slosh test was conducted for the drum to continue in transport. The impacted pads were containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDE experienced a UN1992 Lacquer Thinner release from (2) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to an overtightened bung cap causing the gasket to warp, and release. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pails and impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050721
item.description:
Report E-2024050721

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 28, 2024, sixteen (16) 1-gallon pails and twelve (12) 1-pint cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted trailer to the extent practicable. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A multi piece shipment was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. During the spill agents investigation they discovered that all four of the packaged in the shipment had a release. Each package was a fiberboard box with a drum inside the drum was inside of a plastic bag. All of the drums were leaking from the cap. They were placed into steel salvage packages and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for movement.

  • Description: Package was found unloading a trailer for the morning sort upside down and leaking. The package was then taken to repack area where it was further examined and noted that there were no orientation arrows present on the box. With the box being loaded upside down one of the bottles had been crushed inwards resulting in a small leak out of the four. Resulting in the top of the box to get wet and tear apart easily when examining the damaged hazmat

item.description:

  • City: ONTARIO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A GROUND TO HAWAII SERVICE PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED PRIOR TO FLIGHT TO HAWAII DUE TO A RATTLE SOUND HEARD COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION WE CAN SEE A COVERED LIMITED QUANTITY MARK BLEEDING THROUGH THE THERMAL LABEL. UPON BOX INSPECTION REVEALED FOUR X 3.5 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE SPAZ STIX PREMIUM PAINTS SPRAY PAINT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024051254
item.description:
Report X-2024051254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/19/2024 at approximately 1845, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 906768 at the ramp facilty in Denver, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods commodity. The shipment consisted of one sealed lead acid battery, packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered showing evidence of spillage. The acid spilled from the battery, however the cause of the spillage is unknown. One employee was reported burned from the acid spillage and was treated with first aid. It does not appear that the commodity was properly identified nor declared as a sealed lead acid battery. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS UNREGULATED ICE-BRIX GEL PACKS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 74E3E3, DAVID'S COOKIES, 11 CLIFFSIDE DR, CEDAR GROVE NJ 07009-1234.

item.title: Report X-2024051334
item.description:
Report X-2024051334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY A LOADER ON THE SD-1/2, DOOR 106. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: It was reported that 30-ounces of Victory Fruit & Vegetable Sanitizer was released from one (1) 58-ounce plastic jug due to the container being punctured at the top upon arrival, spilling out onto the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to assist with cleanup. First Call Environmental deployed soda ash to clean the impacted area. The release Impacted an area of 10’x3’ of trailer floor and a 3’X3’ of asphalt under the trailer. No drains or soil were impacted. First Call Environmental recovered the released material and absorbents. First Call Environmental overpacked the damaged jug and recovered material into one 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 200 ML AEROSOL CAN OF RITUALS FOAMING SHOWER GEL THAT WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567JO, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report E-2024050720
item.description:
Report E-2024050720

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: PORT READING
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 8, 2024 at 1800 Mechanical personnel in the Conrail Port Reading Yard discovered , HSRX 3130 a loaded tank car of Petroleum Distillates (Isomerate) leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Kinder Morgan was notified directly via phone . Conrail Manager of Hazardous Material, Joe Caccamo along with Marion Environmental personnel, investigated the leak and found the source be from the reclosing pressure relief device. Liquid product was escaping from the PRD indicating an overloaded condition. The magnetic gauging device was completely maxed out and showing no vapor space in the tank car. A vacuum truck was used to safely remove approximately 3500 gallons. Cause Code: 419 5 x ( 5 + 5 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 0 ) = 100

item.title: Report E-2024050732
item.description:
Report E-2024050732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: WESTBROOK
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DENNIS K. BURKE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 40512
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver was delivering gasoline to a gas station. He brought 4000 gallons divided between multiple pockets of his trailer. Company policy is to not exceed 90% of a tank's capacity, and upon arrival the driver determined the load would be very close to 90%, so he dropped one pocket at a time, sticking the tank before each pocket, and doing the math to ensure each pocket would fit. Before dropping 1500 gallons from pocket #3, the driver disconnected the delivery hose to stick the tank. He obtained the inch reading, converted it to gallons, did the required math, and determined the product in the pocket would fit. He neglected to re-connect the delivery hose before releasing the product. He realized his mistake immediately, and stopped the flow of product, but in the very short amount of time (just a few seconds, if that) approximately 51 gallons of product was released to the pavement near the fill. The driver immediately gathered absorbent materials and pads from his spill kit, and did everything he could to contain the release, but product flowed away from the fill, entering a Central Maine Power (CMP) underground electrical vault. After stopping the release and containing as much as he could, the driver called our company's 24/7 Safety line to report the spill. The on-call Safety Manager immediately called 911 and was connected to Westbrook Fire who responded. He then called Green Site Services for cleanup, and ME DEP who also responded. When it was determined some quantity of gasoline had entered the electrical vault, the fire department evacuated the area and shut down the street until CMP was able to respond. Ultimately all liquid was vacuumed out of the vault, a confined space team entered and pressure washed the vault, and speedy dry was applied to all surface material, and was subsequently removed and disposed of properly. ME DEP was present for the clean-up as well, and approved.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: WOONSOCKET
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: EQ NORTHEAST, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The material was picked up at the shipper's location in the morning. There was no evidence of a leak at that time. At the 2nd stop of the day, there was an odor in the back of the truck but no observable liquid. The truck returned to the transporter facility and at that point, there was some visible liquid on the container, but no liquid on the floor of the truck. Leaked amount was less than 1 liter. A new gasket was procured, and when the lid was removed to replace the gasket, it was observed that the original gasket had a small section that was not fully seated around the edge. The used gasket was removed and a new one was correctly installed. The shipment continued without further issue.

  • Description: During the filling of the trailer, an end plug thermal pressure relief device(TPRD) had an unplanned activation. The TPRD vent manifold intended to safely route any venting gas appeared to be improperly assembled allowing high pressure hydrogen gas to escape through leaks in the vent manifold. The resulting leaks created ignited the hydrogen causing significant damage to the trailer and damage to the another trailer being filled along side the trailer that caught fire.

  • Description: The package was first discovered by package handler who notified QA (myself). It was wet and had a hole at a top corner of the box. The SAN-I-KING NO 451 solution was undeclared with no hazardous materials markings anywhere on outer container. The product was marked with a CORROSIVE 8 diamond label directly on the product packaging (along with UN1791 marking). Each of the 4 gallon bottles of SAN-I-KING demonstrated a small amount of leakage. No punctures/holes found in/on bottles. There was no inner packing. The bottles were placed inside a thin, unclosed bag.

item.title: Report E-2024050697
item.description:
Report E-2024050697

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN1263 Black Container Stock CV1BK Conventional Black release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 4’ x 12’ area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum, impacted pallets, impacted absorbents, were all containerized into an 85-gallon metal drum, 95-gallon poly drum, and (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING CLASS 3 HAZMAT ON THE WEST IRREGS BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS WET BUT NO LIQUID WAS ACTIVELY LEAKING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN CRUSHED AND WAS AT SOME POINT RETAPED BEFORE MAKING IT TO THE IRREGS BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. ONE BOTTLE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP, AND THREE UNAFFECTED BOTTLES WILL BE RETURNED TO THE SENDER VIA SALVAGE DRUM.

I REPACKED THE 1 DAMAGED BOTTLE INTO ITS OWN DRUM AND THE OTHER 3 WERE REPACKED INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SEPERATELY.   • Description: On May 24, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1170 was dropped and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the concrete and soil. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SMR Rapid Response, LLC (SMR) to remediate the impacted site. RLC advised the CES incident manager that all remediation and disposal would be completed by personnel at the customer location. SMR was advised to stand down as no further action would be needed. Photos were taken to document the scene and SMR personnel noted no further actions required on-site and demobilized.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN1830 Sulfuric Acid release from 5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.55-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due loose caps on the jugs. The jugs were wiped down, caps were secured, and they were re-stacked and secure for shipment on. Sodium bicarbonate and oil dri were then deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN1791 12.5% Sodium Hypochlorite release from a 300-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 15’ area of the concrete dock floor. The cap came off the tote after the container fell off the pallet due to improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed to clean the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A HAZMAT SPILL DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT HAZMAT FLAMMABLE LIQUID SPILL ON THE SORT AISLE OF BAY. PACKAGE WAS SITTING ON SIDE ON THE FLOOR. POOL OF LIQUID AROUND THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DICISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEETS WEARING BOOTS, GOGGLES, GLOVES, AND APRON. USING ZEP ZORBENT TO ABSORB ALL LIQUID. RESPONDER PLACED ALL DAMAGED MATERIAL IN DMN TRAY FOR TRANSPORT TO DMN PROCESSING AREA.

  • Description: On May 23, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was crushed in transit and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. Crews placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum, deployed absorbents to the impacted area, and recovered them with hand tools. All spent absorbents and impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=729268110379 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Solid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=paint PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=10 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=7.6 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )On 5/22/2024 at approximately 2045, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5219632 at the ramp facility in Atlanta, reporting a dry ice spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a polystyrene insert that held a paint shipment packed on dry ice. The outer appeared to lose intergrity fell apart, resulting in the spillage of dry ice. The paint shipment remained unharried. The shipment awaits pick-up by the shipper.

  • Description: On May 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and pads to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into sixteen (16) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum was containerized in 85-gallon drums.

  • Description: On May 18, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote was punctured in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel performed a tote transfer, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to manage the release. All waste was containerized in nine (9) 35-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2024051439
item.description:
Report X-2024051439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP RESPONDED TO A CALL ON DOOR 267. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED FOUND A BOX WITH A 5 GALLON BUCKET INSIDE THAT WAS DAMAGED AND LEAKING. WHEN THE RESPONDER TOOK A CLOSER LOOK FOUND THAT THE 5 GALLON BUCKET HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL ON IT. THE OUTER BOX THAT THE BUCKET WAS IN DID NOT CONTAIN ANY MARKINGS OR INDICATION THAT THIS PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT. THE RESPONDER THEN FOLLOWED ALL DMP PROCEDURES FOR CLEAN UP WITHOUT INCIDENT. ONCE BACK IN DMP IT WAS CONFIRMED THAT THE OUTER PACKAGING HAD NO MARKINGS OR LABELING TO INDICATE THE CONTENTS WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID. RESIN SOLUTION; THE SDS EMAILED IS CLASSIFIED AS RESIN IN A KIT (UN3269). THIS PACKAGE CONTAINS RESIN ALONE (UN1866 AS STATED ON THE PAIL). PER THE SHIPPER THIS IS THE CORRECT SDS.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When tank car PROX 44601 was in the WLE Brewster Car Shop for routine repairs, the carmen used a gas detection meter to check the top of the car for leaks after noticing an odor coming from the car. When they inserted the gas meter inside of the protective housing, the gas meter gave an alarm. They called myself, John Vergis Environmental Officer for the WLE, to come out and look at the car. I determined that the Vacuum Relief device was leaking around the O Ring Seal. I have called the car owner to see how they want to proceed with repairs. As of 5-29-2024, I have not yet heard back from them.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/15/2024 at approximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 2593663 at the station location in Seattle, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing one box of perfume that is packaged for retail. During inspection for return, the accompanying safety data sheet indicated the shipment was indentified as ID800; however, the package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labels, and paperwork. Further inspection of the package contents confirmed the classification. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: It was reported that 2-pounds of Sodium Hydroxide Solid was released from one 50-pound bag. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to assist with cleanup. First Call Environmental reported that the release impacted a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor. First Call Environmental down stacked the pallet and placed the torn bag into a 55-gallon metal drum for disposal. First Call Environmental deployed soda ash to the impacted trailer floor to neutralize the area. The spent soda ash was swept up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Description: GATX 6351 was found to be leaking liquid from the top of the car. Upon investigation by a responder, it was noted that the leak was coming from the liquid line cap. The pressure was relieved from the car to stop the release. The liquid cap was removed and inspected for the gasket, which was present. The cap was then tightened and all other plugs/valves/nuts checked for tightness. The car and ground were cleaned by a contractor.

  • Description: Standard Ground package from USA to Canada was inspected by customs to find invoice description of shampoo does not match package contents. Package was flagged for inspection and when opened revealed that the description was not accurate and there was camp fuel inside. There are no dangerous goods marks or labels on the outer box to indicate flammable camp fuel was inside the box. The package was shipped using UPS account WE5813, Comfylife Intl, 809 Hylton Rd, Pennsauken NJ 08110.

  • Description: It was reported that 5-gallons of Neutral-D04 was released from a 55-gallon plastic drum impacting a 2' x 30' area of the trailer and a 5' x 5' area of concrete dock due to other freight being packed too closely to the drum, puncturing the bottom of the drum. ERTS dispatched E3OMI to assist with cleanup. E3OMI used absorbents to solidify and collect the Neutral-D04 and containerized the collected material and spent absorbents into a 55-gallon metal drum and overpacked the damaged drum into an 85-gallon metal drum for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While on initial decent into XNA on flight AA 4615 LGA-XNA, Forward Flight Attendant smelled a hot smell coming from the forward galley. The flight attendants identified the AA HHD(Hand Held Device/Point of sale device) was the origin of the smell. They deployed the Lithium ion Containment Bag(LCB) and removed the battery with the LCB heat resistent gloves, placed the battery in the LCB and doused it with water. There were no signs of the battery escalating( no smoke, fire or fumes). Flight continued to XNA with out incident and the LCB, with battery, was given to ground ops.

item.description:
Report I-2024050017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: TEKOA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wilbur Ellis Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:00 Hours EST at the intersection of Ramsay Street and Main Street. A Wilbur-Ellis' driver out of the Tekoa, WA branch was cut off in traffic by third-party motorist, causing a shuttle to slide out of the back of a vehicle, resulting in strap failure and product shift. Approximately four (4) gallons of free product, Glypex 5 Herbicide, released to the roadway. There was no report of impact to soil. Nearest storm drain was approximately 100 yards from the spill site. Wilbur-Ellis' driver was able to contain the release using speedy-dry absorbent. Personnel from the Wilbur-Ellis' facility responded to the site and completed the cleanup. Waste was taken back to the facility to be disposed of via the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report I-2024040058
item.description:
Report I-2024040058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: WASHOUGAL
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN EARTH SPECIALTY WASTE SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A shipment of UN11G boxes of UN3175 Solids Containing Flammable Liquids was being transported from the shipping facility to end disposal when a release of approximately two pints of liquid occurred. The release was a result of a compromised inner liner. The liquid released through the van trailer floor and approximately one pint impacted the gravel below. The release was discovered while transferring the trailer's contents and was contained with absorbents. The leaking container was wrapped in non-permeable plastic sheeting before being moved into concrete secondary containment and re-packaged. The initial absorbents were containerized, any remaining residue was absorbed with kitty litter and all spill response debris was containerized for off site management. The impacted soil was containerized and a background sample was taken. Sample results confirmed all spill residue was recaptured and removed. All solid and liquid waste generated was shipped off-site for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024040042
item.description:
Report I-2024040042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T00:38:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: ROSEBUD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wilbur Ellis Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. During product handling at the Wilbur-Ellis' facility in Rosebud, TX. A Wilbur-Ellis' employee was moving a 250-gallon tote containing Grayzon Next Herbicide when he cut a turn short, resulting in a puncture to the bottom of the tote. Approximately 250 gallons of free product released, mostly inside of secondary containment. A small amount of the product, approximately 20 gallons, escaped secondary containment, with 15 gallons hitting concrete, and 5 gallons hitting gravel. There was no reported impact to water. There were no reported injuries or exposures. Wilbur-Ellis' personnel reviewed the SOS and responded with appropriate PPE. The product from the impacted tote was recovered and placed into a secondary tote. The impacted gravel and free product was recovered into containers, and will be disposed of via the facility's waste stream.

  • Description: Fiberboard box containing 2 plastic jugs. One of the jugs had a noticeably loose cap during inspection, which led to liquid contents leaking out during handling. The box absorbed and contained the majority of the spill. The little liquid that did spill onto the dock was covered in neutralizing absorbent powder. Box and both jugs have been soiled/contaminated.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking plastic 5-gallon PAIL containing Touchdown 1N Contact Cement. Due to improper loading / Inadequate preparation for transportation one PAIL fell of a pallet during transit and released an estimated 1-cup of hazardous product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x2’ area. A Contractor overpacked the damaged leaking PAIL and cleaned-up the release using absorbent pads. One 55- gallon DM was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding two damaged 55-gallon steel drums containing hazardous product, H.B. Fuller 14216.One drum was punctured by a forklift and the other was damaged when trying to move it away from the punctured drum. A Contractor was called to overpack both drums. The Contractor advised that an estimated 25-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete beneath the trailer. The trailer floor was impacted in a 15’x8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer was impacted in a 10’x 10’ area. The Contractor used oil dry, absorbent pads, and booms to contain and clean-up the release. Two additional drums of waste were generated for the impacted clean-up debris. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.description:
Report E-2024050618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-10ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that twenty (20) pounds of material was released due to improper loading that punctured four (4) 50-pound plastic bags. Clean Harbors personnel moved all the plastic bags from the pallet to verify only four (4) bags were damaged and then swept up the released material. The damaged bags and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050619
item.description:
Report E-2024050619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Estes
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 15ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 6ft-by-2ft area of the gravel lot and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a puncture damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas. The spent absorbents were recovered and placed along with impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and two (2) 30-gallon poly drums. One additional 30-gallon poly drum containing impacted PPE and a broken-down pallet and one (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing the damaged drum were generated. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050617
item.description:
Report E-2024050617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: MARSHALL
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor, 20ft-by-8ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that twelve (12) gallons of material was released due to a puncture in one (1) 220-gallon poly tote. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent material was gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Leak was observed during an FRA Inspection, notification was made to the PTRA who dispatched our Haz-Mat Response Contractor. On Arrival Haz-Mat Special Services fount that 3 of the 6 swing bolts were less than tool tight. HMSS inspected the gasket and found no issue, swing bolts were tighten per spec in a star pattern, the car was observed for a period of time and no leak was detected, remediation was done and car was released for movement.
